description: Construction of two dwellinghouses attached to an existing terrace of houses (1 x 3 bed and 1 x 2 bed), and roof alterations to the existing dwellinghouse involving conversion of the roofspace into habitable use.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 229/E/00/02 (Location Plan), 229/E/01/01D (Existing Site Plan), 229/E/03/03 (Existing Elevations), 229/03/01 (Existing Views), 229/03/02 (Existing Views), 229/P/01/01A (Proposed Ground and First Floor Plans), 229-4/P/01/02B (Proposed Second Floor and Site/Roof Plans), 229-4/P/03/01A (Proposed Elevations), 229/P/03/08 (Proposed East Elevation Views from pathway and Road), 229-4/E/P/03 (Existing and Proposed Views), 229/P/04/03 (Proposed Views from Horsenden Hill), 229/02 rev B (Planning Report), 229/P/01/03 (Parking Spaces Survey), 229/P/01/04 (Parking Spaces Survey), Tree Survey (Clive Fowler Associates), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those used on the existing dwellinghouse at no. 1188 Greenford Road.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policy 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The residential dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing), and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | No part of the roof of the single storey rear projections hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - E of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no general or roof extensions or alterations, porches, or outbuildings shall be contructed at the site without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise together with ventilation for the proposed residential dwellings shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | No development shall commence until details of foundation type, drainage, and the interaction of the development with existing waste water/sewerage infrastructure on the site have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard water/sewerage infrastructure on the site in accordance with policies 2.5, and 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of hard and soft landscape works, on-site replacement tree planting, and boundary treatment shall been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.4, 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 9, policies 5.2, 5.4 & 5.5 of The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.17, 7.18, 7.19 & 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Tree Protection Measures at the site shall be undertaken in full compliance with the approved details in the submitted Tree Survey (Clive Fowler Associates), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure protection of trees in the vicinity of the site and the landscape value of the area in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.4, 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 9, policies 5.2, 5.4 & 5.5 of The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.17, 7.18, 7.19 & 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | A biodiversity report with suitable mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The biodiversity mitigation measures as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   To ensure protection of biodiversity in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.4, 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 9, policies 5.2, 5.4 & 5.5 of The Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.17, 7.18, 7.19 & 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme of investigation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The archaeological works as approved shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planning Authority, and in accordance with a schedule submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason Heritage assets of archaeological interest may survive on the site. The planning authority wishes to secure the provision of archaeological investigation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development, in accordance with policy 4.9 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
